abstract: United States District Court judge Henry T Wingate issues temporary order halting use of drugs pentobarbital or midazolam for executions, effectively stopping implementation of death penalty in Mississippi; state officials have filed appeal.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Tuesday issued a temporary restraining order blocking Mississippi from using two drugs in executions, shutting down the death penalty in the state for now.
snippet: A federal judge on Tuesday issued a temporary restraining order blocking Mississippi from using two drugs in executions, shutting down the death penalty in the state for now.
